description: From Ancient Greek ἔσχατον (éskhaton) (neuter of ἔσχατος (éskhatos, “last”))  +‎ -logy.

entries.meaning: (countable) System of doctrines concerning final matters, such as death.
(uncountable) The study of the end times — the end of the world, notably in Christian and Islamic theology, the second coming of Christ, the Apocalypse, or the Last Judgment.
